example: a(4) = 5 because among the 2^4 compositions of 5 only 4+1,1+4,2+2+1,2+1+2,1+2+2 contain exactly one 1.
a(4) = 5 because the binary vectors of length 4+1 beginning with 0 and with exactly one singleton are: 00001, 00100, 00110, 01100, 01111. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 29 2014

a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, SeriesCoefficient[ ((1 - x) / (1 + x - x^2))^2, {x, 0, -2 - n}], SeriesCoefficient[ ((1 - x) / (1 - x - x^2))^2, {x, 0, n}]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Nov 29 2014 *)

(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, n = -2-n; polcoeff( (1 - x)^2 / (1 + x - x^2)^2 + x * O(x^n), n), polcoeff( (1 - x)^2 / (1 - x - x^2)^2 + x * O(x^n), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Nov 29 2014 */
def a(n): return 1 if n==0 else 0 if n==1 else a(n - 1) + a(n - 2) + fibonacci(n - 3)
